channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ND
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ND

item.title: Report E-2023050630
item.description:
Report E-2023050630

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-01
  • City: BISMARCK
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: xpo logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 45 pound car batteries (un2794) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 quart of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023051106
item.description:
Report X-2023051106

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-17
  • City: FARGO
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler found damaged hazmat lying on it's side and leaking on the flaps at the tail end of the trailer. QA was called over to assess the situation. The hazmat was then placed in a lined red hazmat tote and brought to QA. QA cleaned the rest of the spill on the flaps with paper towels. Most alcohol had already evaporated at that point, and the jug package was not actively leaking at that point. Clean-up materials were put in a bag and into the red hazmat tote alongside damaged hazmat. DescribePack: The twist-on cap was loose. No other dents or cracks were found. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed upright in a lined red hazmat tote and brought to QA. Cap was twisted on tightly to prevent any further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023050220
item.description:
Report X-2023050220

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-01
  • City: FARGO
  • State: ND
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by incompatible conveyance items getting ready to be placed on main conveyor belt. Exterior packaging was found to be wet and starting to fray. Package was brought to the Quality Assurance area for inspection. Upon inspection, no inner packaging materials used to buffer the 4 plastic jugs of Isopropanol. The jugs had loose caps, causing the product to leak and soil the labels on the jugs. DescribePack: The four jugs of Isopropanol leaked due to loose caps, causing the box to become wet and fray along the edges of the exterior packaging. The labels on the individual bottles of Isopropanol became soiled by leaked product. DurationRel: 36 and MitigateEffect: When package was found, gloves were used for PPE to protect from corrosive materials. Package was likely sitting in a trailer over the weekend, thus unable to be tended to sooner. Tracking system shows package had been in St Paul station 4/29/23, then the trailer with the package was unloaded at Fargo station 5/1/23.
